#summary Java Interface to the Twitter Public API

= Introduction =

tweet4j offers a PublicApi interface to the [http://apiwiki.twitter.com/REST+API+Documentation Twitter API] methods that don't require any user authentication.


= Details =
Support for API methods that don't require user authentication:
Generally the user will use the `PublicAPI` interface, instantiating a `PublicApiClient` instance with a no-parameter-constructor.  The example below shows the methods that are available with this interface.

{{{
// instantiate a PublicApi instance
PublicApi api = new PublicApiClient();

// get the twitter public timeline
List<Status> publicTimeline = api.getPublicTimeline();

// retrieve a twitter user by userId or screenName
User user = api.getUser(userId);
}}}
